pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:5.1: 46. The training rule on giving food
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:6.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā personally gave food to performers, dancers, acrobats, magicians, and drummers, saying,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:6.5: “Venerable Thullanandā is a learned reciter; she’s confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:6.6: Give to her; work for her!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:7.3: “How can Venerable Thullanandā personally give food to lay people?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:7.7: How can the nun Thullanandā personally give food to lay people?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:8.1: ‘If a nun personally gives staple or non-staple food to a lay person or a male wanderer or a female wanderer, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:10.2: anyone who lives in a house.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:11.2: any wanderer apart from Buddhist monks and novice monks.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:12.2: any female wanderer apart from Buddhist nuns, trainee nuns, and novice nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:13.2: apart from the five staple foods
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:13.3: and water and tooth-cleaners, the rest is called “non-staple food.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:14.2: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:15.2: if she gives by body or by what is connected to the body or by releasing, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:15.3: If she gives water or tooth-cleaners, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:16.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:17.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
